moves.4... Be7: The orthodox defense.4...Nbd7 5.e3 c6 6.Nf3 Qa5,the cambridge springs variation, is a sharper alternative
moves.5. Nf3 Nbd7 6. e3 O-O 7. Qc2: The Rubenstein attack.I played this from the Black side against a 1750,so I tried this as White
moves.8. Bh4 b6: Black is playing a variation similar to the Tartakower (Makagonov-Bondarevsky) variation.
moves.9. cxd5 exd5 10. Bd3: forming a battery on the b1-h7 diagonal.
moves.11... a5: !? A novelty!Black's idea is to contest the f1-a6 diagonal.
moves.12. Rad1: A bit dubious 12.Rac1 might be better.
moves.13. Bxa6 Rxa6 14. Rdc1: Admitting his twelth move was a mistake.This is a prophylaxis against c5.
moves.15... Ra8: ?A mistake.1:it loses a pawn. 2:it does nothing to help his position
moves.16... bxc5 17. Bg3: !! A subtle move!White moves his undefended bishop and exposes Black's dark square weaknesses on the Queenside.
moves.17... Nb6: Black thinks his pawn is safe.
moves.18. Nb5: ! this move takes advantage of Black's dark square weaknesses threatening 19.Nc7 using an outpost on a light-square!This is weak square strategy at it's finest!
moves.18... Rc8 19. Na7: Now the knight aims for c6.
moves.19... Ra8 20. Nc6 Qd7 21. Nxe7+: The breaking point.Black loses a pawn thanks to weak squares!
moves.21... Qxe7 22. Qxc5 Qxc5 23. Rxc5: Now white has an advantage,he just needs to convert it.
moves.23... Ne4: ? this removes the defender of d5.
moves.24. Rb5: Removing the other defender of d5.
moves.24... Na4 25. Rdxd5 Nac3 26. bxc3 Nxc3 2: After the flourish of exchanges White is now up two pawns.It is still hard to convert it in a two minor piece vs. Rook ending.
moves.29... f6 30. Rd2: Trying to trade rooks to make things clearer on the board
moves.32... Rcc1 33. Bd6: Avoiding 33...Rh1# if the Bishop doesn't move.
moves.33... Rch1+ 34. Kg3 Rhb1 35. Nf5: the knight now has a good post
moves.35... Kf7 36. Bf4 Rb7: ?? loses the rook.Although Black is objectively lost
moves.37. Nd6+:
Black resigns.
in the resignation note my opponent said was not a pleasure.I replied back and I asked why?He said that the game was too dry.I asked why,then he replied becuase of my age (13) that he made mistakes.He was making excuses for losing the game!I hate when people do this.He thinks it is a valid excuse for losing a game!
